basics.name: Andreas Biberacher
basics.label: Problem Solver || Software Modernization | Data Engineering | Cloud Computing | Cybersecurity & Risk Management | Agile Leadership (改善) ||
basics.summary:
My career in IT started at the age of 18, when I helped out in my father's company supporting the development of a remote test automation tool, later known as cloud-based ECU testing. Since then, I have worked in different roles as Developer, Architect, and Chapter Lead, have gained knowledge in Cloud Computing, Data Analytics, Cybersecurity, and Legacy Modernization, and have worked as a freelancer while completing my master's degree in business informatics.
In my past 6 years at T-Systems (Deutsche Telekom) my professional focus shifted from code and tools to customers and their business challenges. Focusing on designing solution architectures for data-intensive applications.

Key capabilities:
• Building data-driven, cloud-native architectures (Spark, Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP)
• Delivering software with fast time-to-market and regulatory compliance (e.g. GDPR, ISO 27001, BSI IT-Grundschutz)
• Leading multi-national teams (up to 30 people, €5.7M revenue)
• Communicating to versatile stakeholders—from engineering to C-level
• Driving Go-to-Market strategy and technical pre-sales

work.name: T-Systems on site services GmbH
work.summary:
Scope: Elaboration of an interface modernization and standardization strategy for a mainframe-based, mission-critical product data system of a large automotive company.
Sector: Automotive

Main Responsibilities:
• Assessment of existing mainframe based system interfaces and middleware components
• Re-architecting of high demand system modules by decoupling interfaces from the application core
• Standardizing interfaces based on the technologies REST and Apache Kafka
• Designing an event-based data streaming process for business objects to a centralized Data Mesh via Apache Spark
• Representation of company interests in customer architecture boards
• Project management and team coordination (local, nearshore, and offshore)

Tech Stack: Java, Spring, Kubernetes, Azure, AWS, REST, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Mainframe, WebSphere, COBOL, SOAP, CICS, SFTP, IBM MQ, IMS, DB2,  Apache Cassandra, PostgreSQL, arc42, risk management, threat modelling, DevSecOps

work.name: T-Systems on site services GmbH

work.name: Biberacher IT-Solutions
work.summary:
Scope: Full stack software development and management consulting for small and medium-sized companies in the sectors Healthcare, Finance, and Marketing.

Project #1: Digital doctor's office
Project Scope: Digitization and automation of processes in medical practices
Sector: Healthcare
Tasks:
• Development of an application for automated reading, analysis, and visualization of mobile sleep laboratories and long-term ECGs
• Development of an application for automated digitization (OCR scanning) and archiving of patient reports to reduce manual data insertions
• Consultation for ERP systems for medium-sized practices and laboratories

Project #2: Real estate market screening
Project Scope: Identification of historically undervalued commercial properties
Sector: Real Estate
Tasks:
• Data Mining on different data dimensions (e.g. real estate price, standard land value (GIS), insurance claims)
• Developing product metrics (KPIs) in cooperation with the subject-matter expert
• Configuration of automated monitoring and alerting

Project #3: Web Development
Project Scope: Development and maintenance of company websites
Sector: eCommerce
Tasks:
• Security audit of websites based on the OWASP Top 10 security vulnerabilities
• Developing an online shop for event ticket sales with WordPress
• SEO and SEA optimization with Matomo and Pandas

Tech Stack: Java, Python, Angular, PostgreSQL, Prometheus, Grafana, Jenkins, Linux

work.name: QUANTO Solutions
work.summary:
Title: IT security in microservice-based systems - From monolith to a secure cloud-native application

Key findings:
• Microservices have a broader attack surface compared to monolithic architectures. On the other hand, they offer additional potential to achieve high availability and attack mitigation by a defense-in-depth approach instead of pure perimeter defense.
• The API-Gateway and Service Registry are critical components in a microservice architecture and must be protected against specific (e.g., service spoofing, DNS/config poisoning, feigned health status), as well as generic (OWASP Top10, DDoS, MITM) attacks.
• Security audits using NIST CSF and ISO/IEC 27001 help identify and prioritize risks and address them through measures like circuit breakers, single-service-per-host policies, and container isolation.

Tech Stack: Java, Java EE, Spring, Docker, Cloud Foundry (SAP), AWS, MS Azure, Openshift, Jenkins

work.name: Capgemini
work.summary:
Title: Industry 4.0 predictive quality analysis in industrial manufacturing - analysis and visualization of data streams.

Key findings:
• Predictive quality analysis in sensor production can lead to a reduction in production costs between 15-30% depending on the manufacturing depth. 
• The best analytical results came from decaying windows in combination with streaming k-NN (supervised) or streaming k-Means (unsupervised) learning algorithms. McDiarmid decision trees can be an alternative, if sufficient computing resources are available and resistance to noise is required.
• As a reference architecture for distributed k-Means real-time analyses, Apache Spark with Hadoop is a suitable choice.

Tech Stack: Business case analysis, Hadoop, Spark, Python, PyTorch, AWS, Tableau

volunteer.summary:
Scope: Volunteer mentor at Groundbreaker gGmbH's mentoring program for women in tech.
The one-year mentoring program aims to provide career starters with the tools they need to enter the world of software engineering.
